column4: can any one help me with my Realtek RTL8136 Desktop Etherenet Controller it's not working
can any one help me with my Realtek RTL8139 Desktop Etherenet Controller it's not working oops it's RTL8139 not8136
I just installed ubuntu on this computer It shows up in lspci but the ethernet light on my modem is not on even though it is connected.
try installing wicd instead of the default network-manager
i had the same prob before, resolved after installing wicd
why? it fixed your prob anyway!
so why not using wicd again?
because this is a different pc and I just installed and never thought of it
ok, misunderstood that you didn't like it :-)
wicd does not work for you?
does wicd see your card after installation?
can i see the output of ifconfig command
print the output of $ cat /etc/network/interfaces
it lists the loopbacks: auto lo & iface lo inet loopback
ok, you add 2 lines "auto eth0 & iface eth0 inet dhcp" (& means new line), then do the command $ dhclient eth0
add two lines to what
into the file /etc/network/interfaces
Can you hold on just on second someone posted a fix on my forum thread and I'm trying that now.

Thank you so much for your help but it turns out a setting in windows was messing me up in ubuntu aparantly windows would disable the card at shutdown and not reenable until next windows boot.  But thanks again
i dont think so, cause i encounter this error before
but changing this setting has fixed my ethernet.
THe info is on this page http://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Configuring_network#Realtek_No_Link_.2F_WOL_issue
